schedule.exampleApplication: A simple counter contract to learn variable declaration, function creation, and basic arithmetic. Like a YouTube view counter, tracking how many times a button is clicked.
schedule.logicalProgression: Foundational syntax and basic contract structure.

schedule.exampleApplication: A contract that stores and retrieves a user's name and status, teaching basic data storage. Like Instagram profiles, where users can store and retrieve their names.
schedule.logicalProgression: Introduces data types and state management.

schedule.exampleApplication: A simple voting contract where users can vote, demonstrating arrays and mappings. Like Twitter/X polls, where users vote for their favorite option.
schedule.logicalProgression: Introduces complex data structures (arrays, mappings) and logic.

schedule.exampleApplication: A basic auction contract to learn conditional logic and time-based operations. Like eBay, allowing users to bid for items, and the highest bid wins.
schedule.logicalProgression: Adds control flow and time management.

schedule.exampleApplication: A contract with an owner who can perform privileged actions, demonstrating basic access control. Like being an admin in a Discord server, where only certain users have control.
schedule.logicalProgression: Introduces basic access control patterns.

schedule.exampleApplication: A basic bank contract to learn how to manage Ether, track balances, and use msg.sender. Like a digital piggy bank, where users can deposit and withdraw savings.
schedule.logicalProgression: Applies address type, msg.sender, and Ether handling.

schedule.exampleApplication: A simple token transfer contract where users can send tokens, teaching basic validation and gas considerations. Like sending money on Cash App, transferring tokens between users.
schedule.logicalProgression: Introduces token basics and gas handling.

schedule.exampleApplication: A donation contract where users can send Ether, demonstrating handling Ether payments. Like "Buy Me a Coffee", where users can send tips to support a creator.
schedule.logicalProgression: Deepens understanding of Ether transfers.

schedule.exampleApplication: A contract that interacts with another contract to retrieve or modify data. Like a calculator app, where one contract asks another to compute something.
schedule.logicalProgression: Introduces inter-contract communication.

schedule.exampleApplication: A contract that emits events when certain actions occur, demonstrating event usage. Like Fitbit or Strava, logging fitness activities or app actions for tracking progress.
schedule.logicalProgression: Introduces event logging for debugging and tracking.

schedule.exampleApplication: A contract using the Ownable pattern for robust access control. Like a smart lock system, where only the owner has access.
schedule.logicalProgression: Builds on basic ownership with a standard pattern.

schedule.exampleApplication: A basic ERC20 token implementation, teaching token standards. Like a custom in-game currency, for a multiplayer game.
schedule.logicalProgression: Introduces standardized token interfaces.

schedule.exampleApplication: A contract that sells tokens for Ether at a specific rate, teaching token economics. Like Kickstarter, where users buy tokens before a project launches.
schedule.logicalProgression: Applies ERC20 concepts to a real-world scenario.

schedule.exampleApplication: A contract demonstrating storage patterns and avoiding collisions, teaching storage efficiency. Like Google Drive for blockchain, storing data securely.
schedule.logicalProgression: Focuses on efficient storage management.

schedule.exampleApplication: A contract optimized for gas efficiency, demonstrating advanced optimization techniques. Like choosing low-power mode on a phone, optimizing for efficiency.
schedule.logicalProgression: Builds on storage efficiency with gas optimization.

schedule.exampleApplication: A contract using delegatecall to call library functions, teaching code reuse. Like a browser extension store, allowing users to load external functionality dynamically.
schedule.logicalProgression: Introduces advanced execution control.

schedule.exampleApplication: A contract using a proxy pattern for upgradeability, demonstrating advanced contract management. Like software version updates in mobile apps, where an app upgrades without reinstalling.
schedule.logicalProgression: Applies delegatecall to contract upgrades.

schedule.exampleApplication: A contract that fetches data from an oracle, demonstrating external data integration. Like a weather app, fetching real-time data from an external source.
schedule.logicalProgression: Introduces external data integration.

schedule.exampleApplication: A contract that verifies signatures, demonstrating authentication techniques. Like logging into a site with MetaMask, verifying signatures.
schedule.logicalProgression: Introduces cryptographic authentication.

schedule.exampleApplication: A contract with reentrancy protection, demonstrating security best practices. Like a secure crypto vault, preventing hackers from draining funds.
schedule.logicalProgression: Introduces critical security concepts.

schedule.exampleApplication: A contract for minting simple NFTs, teaching NFT standards.
schedule.logicalProgression: Introduces NFT standards.

schedule.exampleApplication: A decentralized lottery using Chainlink VRF for randomness, demonstrating real-world applications.
schedule.logicalProgression: Applies external data and randomness to a practical application.

schedule.exampleApplication: A basic lending pool contract, demonstrating DeFi concepts.
schedule.logicalProgression: Introduces core DeFi concepts.

schedule.exampleApplication: An escrow contract for handling conditional payments, demonstrating secure transactions.
schedule.logicalProgression: Focuses on secure, conditional transactions.

schedule.exampleApplication: A contract implementing a simple AMM, demonstrating liquidity provision.
schedule.logicalProgression: Introduces advanced DeFi with AMMs.

schedule.exampleApplication: A basic NFT marketplace contract, demonstrating NFT trading.
schedule.logicalProgression: Applies NFT standards to a marketplace.

schedule.exampleApplication: A basic yield farming contract, demonstrating staking and rewards.
schedule.logicalProgression: Builds on AMMs with yield farming.

schedule.exampleApplication: A basic DAO contract for voting on proposals, demonstrating decentralized governance.
schedule.logicalProgression: Introduces decentralized governance.

schedule.exampleApplication: A basic stablecoin contract, demonstrating stablecoin mechanics.
schedule.logicalProgression: Expands on DeFi with stablecoin mechanics.

schedule.exampleApplication: A minimal decentralized exchange, demonstrating token swaps and liquidity pools.
schedule.logicalProgression: Combines many DeFi concepts into a practical application.
